post_text:
INTRODUCING: CURBSIDE MEAL PICK UP!! CORRECTION: pick up time is 9 AM not 8 AM as previously posted. The post has been updated with the correct pick up time.

The school will be providing 1 week's worth of breakfast and lunch meals for HOPE students, starting tomorrow Tuesday, September 1st. Parents/guardians, please pull up to the curbside to pick-up at the school every Tuesday, from 9:00 am – 2:00 pm.

Please see the map of how we want parents/guardians to enter and exit the school’s parking lot to pick up meals.
• ENTER from Minnehaha Ave E and EXIT out on Payne Ave.
• Stay in your vehicle and you will be approached by our staff.

post_text:
Dear families:
This year, to support social distancing, we will be scheduling individual families to come pick up technology for their students who attend HOPE. One of our paraprofessional staff will be contacting you today and tomorrow to schedule a day and time for technology pick up next week. If you do not hear from anyone by tomorrow evening, please contact me personally at phouayang@hope-school.org or simply message me on this Facebook page.

Thank you all for your patience.

post_text:
July 31, 2020

Dear HOPE Families and Staff:

Yesterday, Governor Walz announces a comprehensive back-to-school plan. My administrative team and I are reviewing the details and guidance from the state. Since this information was just released, we need additional time to review and will update all within the next week.

The health of our children, families and staff remain our number one priority. We will be conducting a very short survey to get family input. At the same time, we acknowledge the uncertainty that adds to the stress on our families and staff. We truly appreciate your patience and understanding as we continue to work through this process.

Sincerely,
Maychy Vu
Executive Director
text:
July 31, 2020

Dear HOPE Families and Staff:

Yesterday, Governor Walz announces a comprehensive back-to-school plan. My administrative team and I are reviewing the details and guidance from the state. Since this information was just released, we need additional time to review and will update all within the next week.

The health of our children, families and staff remain our number one priority. We will be conducting a very short survey to get family input. At the same time, we acknowledge the uncertainty that adds to the stress on our families and staff. We truly appreciate your patience and understanding as we continue to work through this process.

Sincerely,
Maychy Vu
Executive Director

post_text: Starting this week, we will be available for walk-in student registration. Our in-person office hours are TUESDAY- THURSDAY from 8:00 AM - 3:00 PM. After hours and in-person registration on MONDAY and FRIDAYS are by appointment only. Please call 651-796-4500 if you need to schedule an appointment with our enrollment team.
text: Starting this week, we will be available for walk-in student registration. Our in-person office hours are TUESDAY- THURSDAY from 8:00 AM - 3:00 PM. After hours and in-person registration on MONDAY and FRIDAYS are by appointment only. Please call 651-796-4500 if you need to schedule an appointment with our enrollment team.

post_text:
Dear HOPE families,
As the Minnesota Department of Education works closely with the Minnesota Department of Health to plan for the 2020-21 school year, we want to hear from families about their experience with the distance learning this spring.
This feedback is extremely valuable to us. This information will allow us to help families as they balance the responsibilities of work and family, while also supporting student learning.
The survey is available here in English, Hmoob, Spanish, and Somali.
Thank you in advance for your response. The survey will close on June 30th.
http://sgiz.mobi/s3/2020-Parent-Distance-Learning-Feedback-Survey
text:

post_text:
***NOW ENROLLING STUDENTS IN GRADES K-8

HOPE Community Academy strives to help our scholars reach their greatest potential. We seek to provide a safe and trusting learning environment where each student is valued and challenged to grow academically, socially, emotionally, and physically.

We welcome all students and families!

If you have any questions, please contact us at (651) 796-4500 or email us at contact@hope-school.org.

We hope to hear from you soon!

post_text: Many children in Minnesota rely on free or reduced-price school meals, and when schools closed statewide due to COVID-19, these children were missing an important source of nutritious food. To compensate, the federal government has approved Minnesota to issue Pandemic EBT: a ONE-TIME payment of $325 food benefit for families with children who would have otherwise received free or reduced-price school meals. A letter will be sent home to all families with further information. You can also read about it on our school's website here: https://hopecommunityacademy.org/covid-19-updates/

post_text: HOPE Community Academy will close school through May 4th, 2020. Governor Walz has issued an executive order for all schools to close through May 4th, 2020. HOPE has implemented the Extended Distance Learning Plan and will follow through with it. We will keep our families updated as we learn of any changes. Thank you for your understanding and support.
